Author: Throwawayingaccount

Comment: ***From Business Insider's Filip De Mott***:  [President Donald Trump's crypto ventures](https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/trump-bitcoin-cryptocurrency-election-outlook-crypto-funding-regulation-biden-novogratz-2024-7)¬†are getting in the way of his own¬†[agenda](https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/bitcoin-price-crypto-industry-donald-trump-election-reserve-regulation-sec-2024-11).  The fate of a bipartisan stablecoin bill has fallen into doubt as congressional Democrats show frustration with the president's crypto moves. The so-called GENIUS Act, once considered a¬†[quick win for the industry](https://www.businessinsider.com/stablecoins-trump-dollar-dominance-dedollarization-crypto-policy-treasury-yield-tether-2025-2), is now losing support on one side of the aisle.  Pushback has grown as Trump and his family dabble in a range of crypto endeavors. These include the issuance of his own¬†[meme coin](https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-crypto-stablecoin-djt-stock-world-liberty-financial-usd1-2025-3)¬†before his inauguration,¬†[involvement in a new stablecoin](https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-crypto-stablecoin-djt-stock-world-liberty-financial-usd1-2025-3), a¬†[possible family stake in Binance](https://www.businessinsider.com/binance-trump-stake-crypto-exchange-world-liberty-cz-cryptocurrency-2025-3), and a partnership between the¬†[Trump Media & Technology Group](https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/djt-stock)¬†and¬†[crypto.com](http://crypto.com/).  Trump will also be present at a dinner for the top holders of his¬†[$Trump memecoin](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-meme-coin-soars-s-president-host-dinner-top-holders-2025-4). The event has even drawn the scrutiny of some Republican backers, such as¬†[crypto-supporting Sen. Cynthia Lummis](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-republicans-raise-red-flags-trumps-private-dinner-meme-coin-hol-rcna204293).  All of that is creating obstacles for the proposed stablecoin legislation. After the bill successfully passed through the Senate Banking Committee in March with bipartisan support, nine¬†[Senate Democrats](https://www.gallego.senate.gov/press-releases/gallego-colleagues-issue-statement-on-genius-act/)¬†warned Saturday that they would not support the legislation in its current form.  [Read more](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-crypto-memecoin-stablecoin-bill-democrats-genius-act-2025-5?utm_source=reddit&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=insider-politics-sub-post).
Author: thisisinsider
